title: Belichick on coaching at UNC: 'I learn every day'
content: North Carolina coach Bill Belichick discussed his new college team, what he has learned the most in his transition from the NFL, and yes, his girlfriend, Jordon Hudson, during a sit-down interview with "Good Morning America" on Friday.

title: Source: 49ers selling 6.2% of team to 3 families
content: The San Francisco 49ers are working to complete the sale of a 6.2% ownership stake in the team to three Bay Area families, a source told ESPN on Thursday.

title: Yanks' Cabrera post-surgery: Return starts today
content: Yankees third baseman Oswaldo Cabrera announced he underwent successful ankle surgery and is looking forward to his return.

title: Soto on Bronx return: It'll be '50,000 against 1'
content: Mets star Juan Soto knows Yankees fans won't be welcoming him with open arms when he returns to the Bronx on Friday night, saying, "Whatever they do, they have a right to do it."

title: Liberty favored to win title; public backs Fever
content: The New York Liberty are favored to become the fourth team in WNBA history to win consecutive championships, but Caitlin Clark's Indiana Fever are right behind them on the oddsboard and are very much the preference of the betting public.

title: Ohtani marks bobblehead night with 2 HRs in rout
content: On his bobblehead night, Shohei Ohtani hit his 14th and 15th homers to tie for the MLB lead, and the Dodgers rolled past the Athletics 19-2 on Thursday night.

title: Eliminated Capitals expect Ovechkin to be back
content: Next season would be the 21st in the NHL for Washington captain Alex Ovechkin, who will turn 40 in September.

title: QB Williams sought to avoid Bears, book details
content: Quarterback Caleb Williams looked to find a way around the NFL's collective bargaining agreement in an effort to avoid being drafted by the Chicago Bears, details from a forthcoming book reveal.

title: ⚾ Will Aaron Judge hit .400? Blast 60 HRs?
content: The Yankees' superstar outfielder is outdoing even himself so far. Will he go over or under his current pace?

title: Derek Carr's puzzling exit from the Saints -- and the questions that remain
content: Derek Carr surprisingly announced his retirement on May 10. The decision -- and the timing -- has insiders throughout the league talking.

title: Predicting the WNBA season: Can Liberty repeat? Will A'ja Wilson win MVP again?
content: New York seeks back-to-back titles and A'ja Wilson is after another MVP. But our expert picks lean toward the Lynx.

title: Golden State Valkyries open season with enthusiastic fans, low expectations
content: As the WNBA finally comes to the Bay Area, eager supporters seem willing to overlook roster question marks.

title: The Knicks might need more OG-Mikal magic to stop the Celtics
content: Chris Herring examines why the Mikal Bridges-OG Anunoby duo is so important to the Knicks' closeout chances.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Can the Maple Leafs force a Game 7?
content: Toronto must win to to keep the series going. Plus, catch up on Thursday's highlights and top players.

title: Who are the best coaches in college football? We rank the top 10
content: Kirby Smart has to be No. 1, or does he? What about Ryan Day? Or Marcus Freeman? Who made our list -- and why.

title: Tiering 25 rookie running backs by expected role: Lead backs, committee options and depth backups
content: Which rookie RBs will make noise in 2025? We grouped 25 draft picks by expected Year 1 role, from Ashton Jeanty to Jacory Croskey-Merritt.

title: Every Premier League team reranked: Spurs, Forest plummet; Man United can't bounce back
content: It's time to rank all 20 teams in the Premier League one final time! Did Man United or Man City bounce back? Could Forest and Tottenham hang on?

title: Kane to face off against Spurs again in friendly
content: Kane will play his former side Tottenham for the second successive summer with Bayern set to host the north London side in a preseason clash in August.

title: Casemiro: Brazil needed 'big name' like Ancelotti
content: Manchester United midfielder Casemiro has praised the hiring of Real Madrid's Carlo Ancelotti for the Brazilian national team.

title: Alonso keen to set new record in Leverkusen finale
content: Bayer Leverkusen will try to set a German league record with a 34th away game in a row without defeat when they take on Mainz 05 in the Bundesliga finale on Saturday.

title: 'Gentleman' Flick pulls Barça off field before party
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick was praised for getting his celebrating players off the pitch as tensions threatened to spill over after they secured the LaLiga title on Thursday with a 2-0 win at Espanyol.

title: Furious Messi saved from red card by Arena
content: San Jose Earthquakes head coach Bruce Arena helped save Lionel Messi from receiving a red card following the final whistle of Wednesday night's game against Inter Miami.

title: Utd co-owner Ratcliffe's wealth drops by $8.6B
content: Manchester United minority owner, Sir Jim Ratcliffe, has seen his wealth fall by £6.473 billion in the past 12 months, according to the latest Sunday Times rich list.

title: Pimblett on TAA Liverpool exit: 'Strung us along'
content: UFC lightweight and die-hard Liverpool fan Paddy Pimblett has slammed Trent Alexander-Arnold's exit from the club.

title: The 49ers are back! Trouble for the Cowboys! Let's overreact to the NFL schedule reveal
content: Will the 49ers roll into the playoffs? Can the Giants, Lions and Cowboys overcome tough slates? Let's size up schedule reveal fallout.

title: Each NFL teams' social media 2025 schedule release
content: The 2025 NFL schedule was released Wednesday, prompting unique reveals by multiple teams on social media.

title: Amid growing pains at Ferrari, will Hamilton win in F1 again?
content: Lewis Hamilton is not accustomed to losing, but he's been doing a lot of it. Will that ever change at Ferrari?

title: Welcome to Banditland: Buffalo eyeing an NLL championship three-peat
content: The Bandits are on the verge of history, while star Dhane Smith is also chasing down an all-time record -- owned by his coach.

title: UFC Fight Night: Does Burns have a best path to ending Morales' unbeaten run?
content: Who has the edge in this week's UFC Fight Night? An MMA coach and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Every NHL team's biggest prospect pipeline need -- and the draft prospects who could fill them
content: Only one out of 32 prospect pools is truly balanced. For the rest, here's what they need to do on June 27-28.

title: Fantasy facts vs. feelings on Clark, Bueckers and more
content: Liz Loza helps fantasy managers separate the facts from the feelings leading up to the start of the 2025 WNBA season.

title: Paige Bueckers' hometown temporarily renames itself after Wings rookie for WNBA debut
content: Hopkins, Minnesota, will have a ribbon-cutting ceremony, food and beverages named after Bueckers, and a watch party for the WNBA rookie's debut.

title: FA Cup win won't save Man City, but it can kick-start their rebuild
content: Manchester City have had their fair share of struggles this season, but a win over Crystal Palace in the FA Cup final could spark their return to the top of English and European soccer.

title: Turkish firm Celebi moves Delhi HC against revoking of security clearance
content: The security clearance of the firm was revoked days after Turkiye backed Pakistan and condemned India's strikes on terror camps in the neighbouring country

title: Dreams of football fans in Kerala of watching Messi live dashed
content: Sports Minister announced in November last year that the Argentina national football team featuring Messi will play two exhibition matches against Japan and Qatar in Kerala in 2025.

title: Teacher unions boycott meeting with officials, demand immediate solutions to critical issues
content: Accusing the School Education Department officials of “unilaterally implementing policies’‘ without taking teachers’ suggestion into consideration, the unions threaten to intensify protests across the State

title: Monsoon draws near, but community squads to fight natural calamities are in disarray
content: Review meetings are yet to be convened to discuss the strengthening of community rescue squads and the enrolment of new members after field-level training by experts

title: R. Bindu launches CoE in drone pilot training, remote pilot training centre
content: The drone pilot training centre is the second Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA)-approved facility in Kerala

title: Press bodies express concern over arrest of Gujarat Samachar’s owner
content: Multiple organisations demand Bahubali Shah’s immediate release ‘unless credible evidence is presented in a transparent manner’

title: Southern Railway GM holds meetings with MPs, Constituency-wise infrastructure development works reviewed
content: Efforts are on to improve railway infrastructure under the Thiruvananthapuram Division, Railway officials say

title: Modi is a coward who fears Nehruvian ideology: Palakkad DCC president
content: The District Congress Committee president inaugurates a rally in protest against the Modi government’s decision to rename Nehru Yuva Kendra as Mera Yuva Bharat.

title: BJP takes out huge Tiranga Yatre in Hubballi
content: A huge march under the aegis of the BJP pays tribute to martyrs and celebrates the success of Operation Sindoor in Hubballi

title: Tumakuru metro extension: BMRCL submits feasibility study for 59.60-km stretch
content: Proposed stretch will feature 26 stations and, if approved, would become the first intercity metro corridor under the Namma Metro network.

title: Traffic snarls on NH-544: Thrissur Collector seeks urgent report
content: A high-level review meeting involving all elected representatives concerned will be convened next week to discuss the issue

title: Visakhapatnam set to create a new record on International Yoga Day
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi to participate in the event to be conducted at RK Beach on June 21; a ‘Yoga Month’ to be observed from May 21; Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu asks officials to involve 5 lakh people by conducting yoga sessions across all suitable locations along the coastline from R.K. Beach to Srikakulam

title: Road rage murder: 2 CISF personnel remanded in 14-day judicial custody
content: A 25-year-old chef with a flight catering service was allegedly run over and killed following an altercation over overtaking

title: NCSC team visits Vadakadu; Pudukottai Collector inspects affected areas
content: S. Ravivarman, Director, NCSC, Chennai, says a detailed report about the damage to properties of Scheduled Castes will be forwarded to the Commission’s headquarters in Delhi within two days

title: With electrification work completed, Karaikal-Peralam railway line is ready for inspection
content: Train services on Karaikal-Peralam line set to be resumed after a gap of 40 years;   Principal Chief Electrical Engineer, Southern Railway, to inspect the overhead electrification works on May 20

title: Butterfly migration this year takes flight over Garden City earlier than expected
content: Although the migration of butterflies from Western Ghats to Eastern Ghats is a regular phenomenon before the southwest monsoon, this year, due to temperature changes, the movement and sighting of the insects has increased in the region, according to the experts.

title: KILA gets Capacity Building Commission accreditation
content: Recognition opens doors for institute to showcase Kerala’s development model and local governance success stories at the national level

title: APCRDA to hold Mini Job Fair at Thullur on May 20
content: Various companies to recruit freshers and experienced candidates for posts in Amaravati, Guntur, Vijayawada region

title: Production workshop to raise awareness about drug addiction among youth
content: As part of the May 8-22 outreach activity, a troupe called ‘Nalam Naadi’ has been formed with students from Chennai, Tiruchi, Tirunelveli, and other cities, under the guidance of Tamil film actor N. Shanmuga Raja

title: Man Who Stabbed Author Salman Rushdie Sentenced To 25 Years In Prison
content: The man convicted of stabbing Salman Rushdie on a New York lecture stage in 2022, leaving the prizewinning author blind in one eye, was sentenced Friday to serve 25 years in prison.

title: Brain-Dead Woman Forced To Carry Fetus To Birth In US Because Of Abortion Ban
content: The law, known as the "heartbeat law," restricts abortion once cardiac activity is detected, which is generally around six weeks into pregnancy.

title: "Fanciful Ideas": Top Court On Plea Claiming Rohingyas Dropped In Andaman Sea
content: The Supreme Court on Friday rapped petitioners who claimed 43 Rohingya refugees including women and children were dropped in the Andaman sea for deportation to Myanmar and said "when the country is passing through a difficult time, you come out with

title: Turkish Aviation Firm Celebi Goes To Court After Centre Revokes Clearance
content: A day after its security clearance was revoked by the Centre citing national security reasons, Turkey-based aviation firm Celebi has approached the Delhi High Court challenging the decision.

title: UP Teen Dies By Suicide After Mother Scolds Her For Using Phone: Cops
content: A 17-year-old girl allegedly killed herself by consuming poison in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia district early Friday after being scolded by her mother for using a mobile phone, police said.

title: World's Largest Chicken Exporter Brazil Confims Bird Flu Outbreak
content: Brazil, the world's largest chicken exporter, confirmed its first outbreak of bird flu on a commercial farm on Friday, triggering a country-wide trade ban from China and state-wide restrictions for other major consumers.

title: Menendez Brothers Case Reflects Shifting Culture Across Decades
content: The trials of Lyle and Erik Menendez came at a time of cultural obsession with courts, crime and murder, when live televised trials captivated a national audience.

title: "Blind Lust To...": Omar Abdullah, Mehbooba Mufti's Spat Over Pak Water Pact
content: A public spat broke out between Jammu & Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah and his predecessor, Mehbooba Mufti, on social media on Friday over calls for revival of the Tulbul Navigation project.

title: "Always Ready to Freak Off": Explicit messages Read Out At Sean 'Diddy' Combs Trial
content: R&B singer Cassie was pressed to read aloud her explicit messages to ex-boyfriend Sean "Diddy" Combs in federal court, including texts that showed her expressing desire for the drug-fueled group sex she previously testified left her traumatised.

title: India Pakistan Ceasefire Highlights: IMF Must Rethink Assistance To Pakistan, Says Rajnath Singh
content: India Pakistan Ceasefire Highlights: India on Friday called on the International Monetary Fund (IMF) to reconsider its $1-billion assistance to Pakistan, suggesting that Islamabad could use it for terror funding.

title: "Want Life Of...": Justice DY Chandrachud To NDTV On New Role As Professor
content: Former Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud, who demitted office in November last year, will now work as a distinguished professor at the National Law University (NLU), adding a new chapter in what he calls a life of "socially purposive activities".

title: Cow Races To 3rd Floor Of Pune Building To Escape Stray Dogs, Rescued
content: Residents of a 'wada', traditional building, in Pune, woke up to a racket when a cow climbed to the third floor of the structure after being chased by stray dogs in the early hours of Friday, an official said.

title: Video: Truck Rolls Back On Slope, Misses Woman On Scooter By Inches
content: A Kerala woman had a near-death experience after a truck lost control on an incline and rolled backwards into her scooter on the road to Kozhikode Medical College.

title: Zelensky Calls For Sanctions Against Moscow If Istanbul Peace Talks Fail
content: Negotiators from both the countries will meet today on Friday for the first peace talks after more than three years.

title: NASA's Cleanrooms Discover 26 New Types Of Bacteria That Could Survive Space
content: Scientists have discovered 26 new types of bacteria growing inside NASA's cleanrooms - the place where spacecraft are built.

title: World Press Photo Suspends Credit For "Napalm Girl" Picture Over Authorship Doubts
content: World Press Photo suspended on Friday the credit for who took one of the most iconic pictures in history, the Vietnam War image "Napalm Girl", after doubts were raised over the photograph's authorship.

title: Opinion: Blog | Barbed Wire, AK-47s: When I Almost Saw A 'Most Wanted' Pakistani Terrorist
content: The man was walking away from me, about 100-150 metres away. I shouted out his name. He stopped, but didn't turn. The muzzles of at least half a dozen AK-47s were pointed at me.

title: For Pak, India's Air Defence Network Is A 'Never Seen Before' Disruptive Tech: 10 Points
content: How did India hit 13 targets including eight airbases at strategic locations in Pakistan so precisely? How did Pakistan fail so miserably? These questions have left experts around the world looking for answers. The government shared some insights.

title: "Incredible Culture" Trump Says On First Visit To A Mosque As President
content: Trump expressed his admiration for the mosque's beauty, saying, "Isn't this beautiful? It is so beautiful. This is an incredible culture." He also marvelled at the fact that the mosque had been closed for the day in his honour.

title: "Why Does Pak Need Lashkar, Jaish When...": Ex-Envoy On Tensions With India
content: Pakistan must shut down terrorist organisations to avoid further sharp confrontations with India, as the Pahalgam terror attack had brought the country to the brink of war, former Pakistani ambassador to the United States Husain Haqqani has said.

title: Man City keep or dump: How should Guardiola & Co. rebuild?
content: It's been a bad season for Pep Guardiola and Man City, and it's clear they're in a full rebuild mode.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool in for Chelsea's Nkunku
content: Liverpool have joined the race for Chelsea forward Christopher Nkunku. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Court raps Delhi and Uttar Pradesh Police for mishandling student’s mysterious death
content: The Delhi HC ordered the Delhi Police to file an FIR immediately for the death that had occurred last December, and the Uttar Pradesh Police to begin investigation without delay

title: CPI(M) and Congress blame each other for Kannur violence
content: CPI(M) says the Congress sought to divert attention from the public embarrassment caused by its internal leadership rifts. Congress says CPI(M) had shamed the Sangh Parivar by violently opposing the erection of a memorial for Mahatma Gandhi at Malapattam

title: Precautionary measures put in place in Dharwad district
content: Deputy Commissioner and Chairperson of DDMA Divya Prabhu G.R.J. says 20 sensitive places have been identified in terms of security

title: Central districts show significant improvement in State board Class 10 exams
content: With 96.61% pass result, Tiruchi district finished in the fifth position in Class 10 results this year; Ariyalur district secured the first position in Class 11 results

title: Govt. committed to early completion of Handri-Neeva Sujala Sravanthi, says A.P. Water Resources Minister Nimmala Ramanaidu
content: As per the directions of the Chief Minister, the first phase should be completed by June, he says; the project aims at providing irrigation water to more than 6 lakh acres across six districts and drinking water to 35 lakh people spread over 81 mandals in the Rayalaseema region

title: Maharashtra selects seven beaches for Blue Flag certification
content: State government identifies beaches across four districts; proposals under review by national jury ahead of international assessment

title: Notary, municipal staff among 13 accused in fake document scam unearthed by Rachakonda police
content: The members of the racket are reported to have sold nearly 280 fake sale deeds at prices ranging from ₹5,000 to ₹20,000 each, the police said

title: Severe drop in tapioca prices leaves Tiruchi farmers struggling
content: A 75-kg bag of tapioca, which fetched ₹850 last year, is now being sold at just ₹450; the 10-month labour intensive crop is cultivated on 3,500 hectares in Tiruchi district

title: Trainee IAS officers visit Vidyut Soudha, get insight into  State’s power sector
content: They witness real-time grid operations and load management besides gaining knowledge on various aspects of power generation and transmission through interaction with officials

title: New integrated vegetable market in Tiruchi to have more than 1,000 shops
content: Minister for Municipal Administration M.N. Nehru inaugurates the construction work; the complex will come up on 20 acres of land near the integrated bus terminus in Panjapur

title: Closure of IRCTC contractor’s kitchen: railway panel to look into larger issues
content: The three-member committee will look into the quality of food being served on trains and recommend corrective measures

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Telangana Chief Minister asks energy officials to gear up to meet increasing demand with focus on RE
content: Revanth Reddy wants authorities to ensure no power towers, poles, cables are visible in Future City, to install smart poles around Secretariat

title: Kottayam village monopolises a staple snack for church festivals
content: Around 12 to 15 families at Velluthuruthy are keeping alive the art of making Uzhunnada, a nearly 200-year-old delicacy made by hand using tapioca powder and black gram. The snack is available only during the church feast season from November to May

title: 2020 Delhi riots: Court acquits 11 of arson, theft charges
content: Additional Sessions Judge Pulastya Pramachala observed the two police witnesses who identified the accused persons in the case appeared to be ‘artificial eyewitnesses’

title: Advances in developing eco-friendly launch vehicle systems reflect ISRO’s commitment to sustainable practices in space exploration: VSSC Director S. Unnikrishnan Nair
content: ‘ISRO has made advancements in developing eco-friendly systems using semi-cryogenic, cryogenic and Liquid Oxygen-Methane propellants’

title: 3 workers die of asphyxiation while cleaning septic tank at factory in Ahmedabad
content: The official said the unit had remained shut for some time, and the owner wanted to restart the facility and had hired a contractor to clean the septic tank.

title: ICAR-CTCRI, CISSA join hands to strengthen 36 farmer producer companies
content: The FPCs will be equipped with skills in value chain development, processing, packaging, branding, and marketing

title: Pre-monsoon preparations in full swing in Alappuzha
content: The panchayat-level disaster management committees will be convened to assess the situation in each local body ahead of the monsoon season. Steps will be taken to prevent waterlogging. Drains will be cleaned in advance to ensure proper water flow.

title: GJC urges nationwide ban on gems, jewellery trade with Turkiye, Azerbaijan
content: This comes after Turkiye's public support for Pakistan in the wake of Operation Sindoor, the GJC said in a statement

title: Police inspector suspended for negligence in probe into desecration of idgah in Belagavi district
content: He also faces the charge of delaying action into the alleged desecration of holy books stolen from a mosque in the village

title: Belagavi police arrest four persons for idgah desecration
content: They face charges of damaging four gumbazs (domes) of the idgah, desecration of some graves and name plates

title: JNTUA’s 14th Annual Convocation on Saturday
content: Emeritus Professor and former faculty member of IIT Kanpur M. R. Madhav, will deliver the Convocation Address

title: Telangana achieves 75.85% revenue target in 2024-25, spends 51% of it on wages, pension and interest payment
content: While revenue receipts were ₹1.67 lakh crore in 2024-25, 51% (₹85,883 crore) of was spent on wages, pension and interest payment

title: Final call on Baldota steel plant in Koppal will be taken after reviewing report of Deputy Commissioner, says Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah
content: He made this announcement at Hosapete in Vijayanagara district on May 16 when reporters drew his attention to concerns that work on the proposed plant was continuing despite the Chief Minister’s orders for cessation

title: Decks to be cleared for polls to Greater Bengaluru Authority in four months, assures D.K. Shivakumar
content: The Minister in-charge of Bengaluru Development also said the government would soon take up the issues of “reservation” and “division” of the Greater Bengaluru Authority.

title: IIT Roorkee withdraws from MoU with Turkish university amid rising diplomatic sensitivities
content: The move follows JNU’s suspension of academic ties with Inonu University and broader disengagement by Indian entities in response to Türkiye’s stance on Pakistan

title: Anantapur MP urges Railway Minister to take up renovation of  Anantapur station
content: MP Lakshminarayana requested the Union Minister of State for Railways to initiate steps for granting additional rail services to the Anantapur region and modernizing the existing facilities

title: PSLV-C61 launch: ISRO chief Narayanan seeks blessings at Tirumala shrine
content: Vedic scholars offered blessings at the Ranganayakula Mandapam, while temple officials presented holy water and honoured Mr. Narayanan with a silk shawl

title: President Murmu’s reference to Supreme Court falls within her Constitutional rights: Annamalai
content: Interacting with mediapersons in Tiruvannamalai, Mr. Annamalai said that under Article 143 (1) of the Constitution, the President can clear her doubts with the Supreme Court on its rulings

title: Karnataka internal reservation: Deadline extended to May 25 to complete door-to-door survey of Scheduled Castes
content: As a result, the special booth-level camps will be held between May 26 and May 28. Those wishing to declare online can do so between May 19 and May 28

title: As Pakistan reels from Op Sindoor, Baloch makes move to break free
content: Razzak Baloch asserts Pakistan's diminished control in Balochistan, urging international support for the Baloch struggle, particularly from India and the United States. Mir Yar Baloch has declared independence from Pakistan, highlighting historical grievances and alleged exploitation. The Baloch independence movement traces back to 1947, fueled by claims of forced annexation and human rights abuses.

title: How India can be big winner of Trump 2.0 era — if it plays its cards right
content: India is emerging as a promising investment destination amid global economic uncertainties, driven by its robust growth and potential trade deal with the US. Despite a slight downward revision in GDP forecast, investor confidence is surging, reflected in renewed capital inflows and a thriving domestic stock market.

title: Watch: Ritika Sajdeh in tears as Rohit Sharma stand inaugurated at Wankhede
content: The Mumbai Cricket Association honoured Rohit Sharma by unveiling the Rohit Sharma Stand at Wankhede Stadium. His wife, Ritika Sajdeh, was visibly moved during the ceremony. A video captured her emotional reaction as the stadium stand was renamed. Tributes poured in, including a message from Suryakumar Yadav. Akash Ambani, MI owner, attended the event.

title: Jamie Dimon to employees: Don't tell JPMorgan what to do, you can't learn from ...
content: JP Morgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon is firm on the company's return-to-office mandate, asserting that employees will ultimately be happier. He emphasized the importance of in-person apprenticeship for younger staff, dismissing hybrid work models. Dimon has been a vocal critic of remote work, citing concerns about productivity, innovation, and spontaneous learning.

title: 'Weaponising water': Omar, Mehbooba spar over IWT
content: Mehbooba Mufti has criticized Omar Abdullah's call to revive the Tulbul Navigation Project amidst India-Pakistan tensions. She deemed his statements irresponsible, emphasizing that J&K needs peace, not actions risking further conflict. Abdullah suggested resuming the project, suspended due to Pakistani objections under the Indus Water Treaty, now that the treaty is in abeyance.

title: Author Salman Rushdie's attacker sentenced to 25 years in prison
content: Hadi Matar received a 25-year prison sentence for the 2022 on-stage stabbing of Salman Rushdie at a lecture in New York. The attack, which left Rushdie blind in one eye and severely injured, stemmed from the decades-old fatwa. Matar, who criticized Rushdie before sentencing, faces a federal trial on terrorism charges related to the incident.

title: India A squad announced for England tour, Easwaran named captain
content: The All-India Senior Men’s Selection Committee has announced the India A squad for their upcoming tour of England. Abhimanyu Easwaran will captain the team, which includes promising talents like Yashasvi Jaiswal and Dhruv Jurel. India A is set to play two four-day matches against the England Lions in Canterbury and Northampton.

title: BMW CEO tells how it was right on 'Tesla trend', unlike Mercedes & Volvo
content: BMW CEO Oliver Zipse asserts his company's cautious EV strategy is succeeding as rivals scale back ambitious targets. Zipse highlights BMW's multi-drivetrain approach, including combustion engines and hybrids, as superior to solely focusing on EVs.

title: Pak's ex-air marshal admits AWACS damaged in Op Sindoor
content: Retired Pakistani Air Marshal Masood Akhtar admitted on camera that Indian precision strikes under Operation Sindoor damaged a Pakistani AWACS aircraft at Bholari airbase. The strikes, a retaliation for the Pahalgam terror attack, targeted key military installations, contradicting Pakistan's attempts to downplay the extent of the damage. Indian Air Marshal AK Bharti confirmed that 11 Pakistani air bases were hit.

title: Turkey-base Celebi moves HC over revoked security clearance
content: Celebi Airport Services India has challenged the government's revocation of its security clearance in Delhi High Court, citing vague national security concerns. The aviation firm argues the decision, impacting thousands of jobs and investor confidence, lacks justification and was issued without warning.

title: 'Protective son' Rohit steals hearts during Wankhede stand inauguration - Watch
content: Rohit Sharma was honoured at Wankhede Stadium with the inauguration of the 'Rohit Sharma Stand.' The event highlighted his cricketing achievements and his deep family values, particularly his affection for his parents. Sharma expressed gratitude to his family and supporters, acknowledging their sacrifices. The Mumbai Indians squad attended the ceremony, which also honored Ajit Wadekar, Sharad Pawar, and Amol Kale.

title: Govt slams Amazon, Flipkart for selling Pakistani flags, cites national sentiment violation
content: The CCPA has issued notices to e-commerce platforms like Amazon and Flipkart for selling Pakistani national flags and merchandise, deemed insensitive and a violation of national sentiment. Union Minister Pralhad Joshi directed the platforms to immediately remove such listings and adhere to national laws.

title: 'West trying to pit India against China': Russia foreign minister
content: Sergei Lavrov, the Russian foreign minister, has accused the West of attempting to create discord between India and China by promoting an anti-China agenda in the Indo-Pacific region. He warned that Western powers are also trying to diminish ASEAN's role in regional affairs by undermining consensus and encouraging divisive groupings.

title: Watch: Rohit gets emotional as parents inaugurate stand with his name at Wankhede
content: The Mumbai Cricket Association honoured Rohit Sharma by unveiling the Rohit Sharma Stand at Wankhede Stadium, Divecha Pavilion Level 3. This tribute celebrates his journey from Borivali to becoming a world-renowned batter. The MCA also dedicated stands to Sharad Pawar and Ajit Wadekar, and an MCA Office Lounge in memory of Amol Kale, recognising their contributions to cricket.

title: How Trump's boast on India-Pak ceasefire could cost US billions
content: Michael Rubin criticizes Donald Trump's claim of brokering a ceasefire between India and Pakistan, arguing it jeopardizes strategic trust and billions in potential defense deals. Trump's boast of leveraging trade to halt hostilities risks undermining the deepening alignment between the US and India, potentially pushing New Delhi away from American arms deals.

title: Shannon Sharpe drops sexually explicit bombshells in rape case
content: NFL Hall of Famer Shannon Sharpe faces a $50 million rape lawsuit, vehemently denying the allegations. His legal team released explicit texts, claiming a consensual relationship initiated by the accuser. The accuser's lawyer argues these texts predate the alleged assault and are a distraction. The lawsuit details a two-year relationship with accusations of manipulation and abuse.

title: 'Pak will spend on terror infra': Rajnath asks IMF to reconsider $1bn loan
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Friday urged the IMF to reconsider its loan to Pakistan, fearing funds will be used for terror infrastructure. India abstained from the vote, citing Pakistan's history of misusing funds and supporting cross-border terrorism. India also highlighted the military's significant control over Pakistan's economy, hindering structural reforms.

title: 'We already have one': Patidar on chances of being first RCB captain to win a trophy
content: The RCB skipper feels that expectations and pressure on him are high. The 31-year-old will have a solid shot at leading his side to glory this season and only needs one win to confirm a spot in the playoffs. He however stressed that RCB already has one title to its name.

title: Watch: Rohit Sharma Stand inaugurated at Wankhede as MCA pays tribute to legends
content: The Wankhede Stadium honoured cricketing legends by inaugurating commemorative sections, highlighted by the naming of a stand after Rohit Sharma, recognising his immense contributions to Indian cricket and Mumbai Indians. Additionally, stands were dedicated to Ajit Wadekar and Sharad Pawar, acknowledging their significant impact on Indian cricket history.

title: 'Grilled every night': BSF jawan recalls 21-day ordeal in Pak
content: BSF jawan Purnam Kumar Shaw, recently freed after 21 days in Pakistan, endured nightly interrogations about BSF deployments, his wife Rajani revealed. Shaw, who inadvertently crossed the border in Punjab, reported being mentally drained despite no physical torture. Treated like a spy and moved to multiple locations, including near an airbase, he was sleep-deprived.

title: Paresh Rawal quits 'Hera Pheri 3' co-starring Akshay Kumar, Suniel Shetty
content: Paresh Rawal, known for his iconic role as Baburao in 'Hera Pheri', has officially exited 'Hera Pheri 3' due to creative disagreements with the producers. This news follows a series of setbacks for the film, including Akshay Kumar's initial departure and subsequent return.

title: Raj Nidimoru-Samantha Prabhu dating since filmmaker's separation: Top 5 news
content: Entertainment headlines are buzzing with Suniel Shetty's joy as a grandfather and Paresh Rawal's exit from 'Hera Pheri 3'. Aamir Khan was spotted with Gauri Spratt, fueling relationship talks. Samantha Ruth Prabhu and Raj Nidimoru's rumored romance is also creating waves, while Amaal Mallik discusses how prioritizing himself strengthened his family ties. Stay tuned for more updates!

title: Kevin Durant slams FS1 analyst Emmanuel Acho over Jayson Tatum take
content: Kevin Durant has strongly criticized former NFL player Emmanuel Acho for his controversial remarks regarding Jayson Tatum's injury and its potential positive impact on the Boston Celtics' performance against the New York Knicks. Durant believes that Acho, and other football analysts, should refrain from commenting on basketball, as they lack the necessary understanding of the sport.

title: How Army acted on specific intel to neutralise 6 terrorists in J&K
content: Security forces in Jammu and Kashmir have successfully neutralised six terrorists in two separate anti-terror operations in Kelar and Tral areas over the past 48 hours. The joint operations by the Indian Army, Jammu and Kashmir Police, and CRPF signify an intensified focus on eliminating the terror ecosystem in the Kashmir Valley.

title: 'A boy from Borivali ...': Ambani congratulates Rohit on Wankhede stand honour
content: Akash Ambani lauded Rohit Sharma as the Mumbai Cricket Association unveiled a stand named in his honour at Wankhede Stadium. Ambani highlighted Sharma's journey from Borivali to becoming a global cricket icon, inspiring a new generation. Sharma's contributions to Mumbai Indians and the Indian national team were celebrated, marking his legacy at the iconic venue.

title: Scientists reveal new working pattern that can cause brain damage: All you must know
content: A recent study reveals that consistently working over 52 hours a week can significantly alter brain structure, impacting executive function, emotional regulation, and decision-making abilities. Researchers from Yonsei University emphasize the importance of addressing overwork as a serious occupational health concern, citing its links to cardiovascular disease, mental health issues, and a high annual death toll. Read more below!

title: Rajasthan man halts mother’s cremation, creates ruckus over jewellery
content: A cremation in Rajasthan's Kotputli-Behror was delayed for two hours due to a dispute over the deceased woman's jewelry. Omprakash, one of the woman's seven sons, halted the funeral, demanding his mother's silver bangles. He lay on the pyre, refusing to move until his demands were met.

title: Brad Marchand smirked at fired-up Leafs' fan as he came face to face with the fan
content: Brad Marchand, now with the Florida Panthers, faced Toronto Maple Leafs fans. A video shows a fan confronting Marchand. Marchand simply smirked at the fan. This interaction sparked funny reactions online. Fans commented on Marchand's reaction and the Leafs' performance. The Panthers and Marchand have not commented on the incident. The video is now viral.

title: Inside story: How, and why, Mayank Yadav broke down. Again!
content: Mayank Yadav's comeback to Lucknow Super Giants was cut short due to injury concerns, raising questions about his rehabilitation. Despite initial excitement, his pace dropped significantly, baffling the team. Sources suggest he was rushed back after limited bowling sessions at the BCCI's Centre of Excellence.

title: UP horror: Wife, her 3 lovers chop man into 6 pieces; head dumped in river
content: In a shocking incident in Ballia, Devendra Ram, a retired electrician, was brutally murdered by his wife and her three lovers. Maya, the wife, and one lover, Mithilesh Patel, were arrested after the discovery of dismembered body parts. Further investigation led to the arrest of Anil and Satish Yadav following a police encounter. They confessed to the murder, revealing the crime was premeditated. Devendra's body was chopped into six pieces, with the head still missing.

title: SC directs Bengal govt to pay 25% DA to its employees; BJP hails directive
content: The Supreme Court has instructed the West Bengal government to disburse 25% Dearness Allowance (DA) to its employees within three months, marking an interim decision in the ongoing dispute over DA parity with central government employees. This directive follows a 2022 Calcutta High Court ruling that aimed to align state DA payments with the central rate.

title: Vijay Shah no stranger to controversies: When Vidya Balan declined dinner invite
content: Vijay Shah, a Madhya Pradesh minister, is in trouble again. The High Court has ordered police to file a case against him. Shah allegedly called Colonel Sofiya Qureshi the "sister of terrorists" at an event in Indore. This isn't Shah's first controversy. He faced criticism in 2020 and resigned in 2013. Shah has apologized and said he respects Colonel Qureshi.

title: Pakistan deputy PM Ishaq Dar cites fake news to laud PAF, gets fact-checked at home
content: Pakistan's Deputy Prime Minister Ishaq Dar faced embarrassment after falsely claiming in the Senate that The Daily Telegraph lauded the Pakistan Air Force as the "undisputed king of the skies." The Dawn, a Pakistani newspaper, debunked Dar's statement, revealing the claim originated from a fake social media image. This incident occurred amidst heightened tensions between India and Pakistan.

title: 'You don't leave the team ... ': Shastri's fiery take on Rohit Sharma
content: Rohit Sharma's decision to skip the Sydney Test earlier this year, despite Ravi Shastri's strong disagreement, has resurfaced. Shastri revealed he would have insisted Sharma play, believing his potential match-winning innings, even a small one, could have altered the series outcome. Earlier in June 2024, Rohit had also called time on his T20I career after leading India to a seven-run victory over South Africa in the final of the 2024 Men's T20 World Cup.

title: Gold best performing asset of FY25 but equities outperform in long-term
content: Gold surged in FY25, gaining 41% in USD and 33% in rupee terms, driven by its safe-haven status and central bank buying. Despite this, Indian equities outperformed gold over longer periods.

title: Former CJI D Y Chandrachud appointed as 'distinguished professor' at NLU Delhi
content: Former Chief Justice of India, D Y Chandrachud, has been appointed as a 'distinguished professor' at National Law University (NLU), Delhi, marking a significant advancement for legal education. NLU Delhi will establish a Centre for Constitutional Studies under his leadership. Starting July 2025, a lecture series will explore Justice Chandrachud's landmark judgments on privacy, LGBTQ+ rights, and judicial reforms.

title: The humans of IPL: Unsung heroes who ensure calm amid the chaos
content: With the 18th edition of the Indian Premier League (IPL) set to resume on Saturday, TimesofIndia.com delves deep into the lives of the individuals who manage everything from booking flights, hotels, and cabs to ensuring the safety and comfort of players and their travelling families, especially in extraordinary situations like the one that unfolded on May 8 in Dharamsala.

title: BJP compares Pakistan's loss to India to Operation Sindoor
content: The Bhartiya Janata Party's official X account posted a video comparing India's victory in a 2007 T20 World Cup bowl-off against Pakistan to Operation Sindoor, India's response to the Pahalgam terrorist attack. The post sarcastically mocked Pakistan's failure in the bowl-off, drawing parallels to the military operation targeting terrorist elements in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

title: Celebi shares crash 10% after India revokes security clearance
content: Celebi Hava Servisi's shares plummeted 10% after India revoked security clearance for its Indian unit, Celebi Airport Services India, citing national security concerns. The decision, impacting operations at nine major airports, follows increasing pressure on the Turkish ground service provider.
